thread.title: Look at Julian Edelman’s finger (or don’t, it’s kind of gross) - Patriots
thread.title_full: Look at Julian Edelman’s finger (or don’t, it’s kind of gross) - Patriots

author: boston.com
title: Look at Julian Edelman’s finger (or don’t, it’s kind of gross) - Patriots
text:
Is this bad?
Patriots receiver Julian Edelman appeared to injure his finger on a touchdown catch in the first quarter of the New England Patriots’ game against the Indianapolis Colts. As Edelman crossed the goal line, Colts linebacker D'Qwell Jackson and safety Mike Adams sandwiched the Patriots slot receiver, whose 12-yard catch tied the game at 7-7.
I don't think it's supposed to bend that way, Julian. pic.twitter.com/HeW4XSuYgO
— Toucher and Rich (@Toucherandrich) October 19, 2015 After Edelman’s touchdown, the Colts had a 3-and-out. Edelman returned the ensuing punt and caught a pass on the Patriots’ first play of the following drive.
Based on a tweet from a Patriots beat reporter, Edelman’s finger injury may have occurred previously.
Edelman's finger has been kinda funky for a long time. Not an injury from tonight. https://t.co/6EB1Yq4e7h
— Jeff Howe (@jeffphowe) October 19, 2015 Or maybe he made it worse? Either way, that’s messed up, dude.
